fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an agent opens a request from a queue it's not possible to navigate the request using shortcuts as the open request doesn't have focus unless it's clicked.

Using shortcuts like CTRL+END (CMD+Down arrow for Mac) to scroll to the bottom of a newly opened request would be useful.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the newly opened request have focus when opened from a queue.

h3. Workaround
Click anywhere inside the open request will allow the use of shortcuts for navigating the page.
fields.summary: Opening a request from a queue removes focus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Next Gen JSD projects, if you set an approver field in the Context fields area, it should be an internal field that should not display the approvers selected on the portal view.

The context fields section (on the request type config page) specifically mentions: "These fields are only available to internal users on your site. They are hidden from customers.", so agents/admins expect the value/users selected in the approver field to be hidden from the portal. This is misleading and is a potential security breach if customers are able to see the internal approvers selected when the agents/admins do not wish to show it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to next gen project > Project Settings
 # Select "Request types" > "Edit workflow"
 # Select a status > select "+" in the Approval section
 # Set the transitions > "Next"
 # "Who chooses approvers?" select "Agent selects approvers"
 # Approver field, create a new one > Save and close
 # Go back to the Request type, the approver field selected will be found under the Context fields section.
 # Create a request and select an approver > Open the request type in the portal view

h3. Expected Results

The approver field selected should be hidden from the request view: !image-2020-04-03-18-29-04-970.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The approver field selected displays the approvers on the request view: !image-2020-04-03-18-29-04-970.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: In Next Gen JSD project, approval fields appear on the portal view despite setting the approver field as internal in the Cotext fields section

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when running a JQL on Service Desk to search X issues from Y project, it is only possible to sort the results by assignee or status. If we wish to exclude issues from a determined assignee or status, we must type it in the JQL.
h3. Suggestion
 * Allow this filtering on these options directly on the columns. For example:
 Running this JQL {{project = TEST}}, when the results come up, from the Assignee column, check only results from assignees we check:
!image-2020-04-02-11-47-31-762.png|width=193,height=231!

(i) The same is valid for the Status column.
fields.summary: Filtering options for Status and Assignee columns

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when you add a field to the view screen of an issue type in a JSD project, all request types associated to that issue type will automatically add the field to their view (agent view).

See an example below:
 !Screen Shot 2020-04-02 at 10.18.25.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-04-02 at 10.18.36.png|thumbnail! 

Depending on the scenario, specially when you have multiple request types associated to the same issue type, and the intention was to have that field only in one request type, it will end up causing the need of a good amount of manual work since it would be necessary to navigate to each individual request type and hide that field in their forms.

h3. Suggestion

Add an option to prevent request types from automatically adding those fields to their internal views.

That would be a good option to users that have a big amount of request types as it would spare them such manual work.

h3. Workaround

Currently, you can navigate to each of the request types and hide the field.

You can also prevent that if each request type is associated with a different issue type.
fields.summary: Ability to prevent request types from automatically inherit fields added in the issue view screen of the associated issue type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the text "What can we help you with" in the customer portal is hardcoded and cannot be edited. Depending on the organization, the text should be editable to fit the targeted users.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to edit the "What can we help you with" text
fields.summary: Ability to edit the "What can we help you with" text

fields.description:
Problem Definition
Currently, the REST API only allows for creating new customers.
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-customer-post

But the endpoint can only be accessed to create a new customer. If there is already inactive user present and if we run the endpoint, an error is thrown stating the user is already created

Suggested Solution
Create a REST API to grant access to  portal only customer if the user is inactive

Why this is important
If you have multiple inactive users doing it using REST API will be faster and less expensive than having to edit all customers one by one through the UI

Workaround
Edit on the UI
fields.summary: Abilty to grant access to portal only customer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a _request type_ that's currently in use is deleted, the issues remain associated to them on background.
e.g.: The JQL "request type is empty" won't return those issues because the association with the deleted _request type_ still exist.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD request
 # Delete the associated _request type_
# Search for "request type is empty" and the issue won't be returned.

h3. Expected Results
The association between issues and the deleted request types is removed.

h3. Actual Results
The issues remain associated to non existing request types.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Issues remain associated to deleted request types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When entering the email address of a user on a request form for a portal which allows *Anyone can send a request without logging in*, whitespace is not trimmed from the email address. This can cause issues where *Jira Service Desk* then tries to create the user, but since that process *does* trim whitespace, the creation will fail. Under some configurations, this can cause the ticket to fail submission. This seems to affect both leading and trailing whitespace.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While not logged into an account, visit a portal which has *Anyone can send a request without logging in* configured in *Customer permissions*
 # Try to submit a request with a pre-existing user, but with leading or trailing whitespace

h3. Expected Results
Leading and trailing whitespace is trimmed and ticket submission occurs.
h3. Actual Results
Leading and trailing whitespace is not trimmed and under some configurations can cause *Jira Service Desk* to then try to create the account (unsuccessfully) and ticket submission fails.

{code}
User with email [user@domain.com ] not found
{code}

Or

{code}
User with email [ user@domain.com] not found
{code}

{code}
msg: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidUserException: User already exists
{code}

h3. Workaround

Ensure that the users are not entering their email addresses with leading or trailing whitespace.
fields.summary: When entering an email address on the ticket submission page of a portal whitespace is not trimmed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we attach a video file within a Confluence page that is part of a knowledge base space linked to a service desk project, besides the [article is shown in the old editor view|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67972], the video is shown as a link that, when clicked, opens a new browser tab, reproducing the video.

h3. Suggestion
Turn the attached video previewed within the article (from the customer portal), in a manner that it gets reproduced within the page, as it is in Confluence (not opening a new tab to get the video).
fields.summary: Reproduce videos from a KB article in the customer portal

fields.description:
At the moment, Jira Service Desk administrators require to take up an agent license to be able to work with and maintain service desk projects. An administrator doesn't necessarily need to work as an agent for the team and Jira service desk licenses are usually limited in numbers. 

Solution :

Allow Jira administrators to configure and maintain service desk projects without taking up any agent license. These type of access should not grant the administrator the capability to work with service desk tickets.
fields.summary: Limited Jira Service Desk administrator access

fields.description:
We want to keep our service desk open to former customer to allow them to check exisiting ticket but preventing them from create new ticket.

The former status should be reversible so that we can "reactivate" a customer account at a later point
fields.summary: Readonly former customer

fields.description: There is an endpoint to fetch the fetch organization for the agent. It will be great if there is an endpoint to fetch organization for the reporter as well.
fields.summary: REST API to fetch organization for the reporter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Accessing the queues URL ([https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<PKEY>/queues|https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues]) while logged off will throw a 404 page instead of asking the user to log in to view the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the queue URL ([https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<PKEY>/queues|https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/queues]);
# Open an incognito mode browser tab and paste the URL;
# Jira will redirect the user to [https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<PKEY>/undefined/jira/servicedesk/projects/undefined/queues|https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/undefined/jira/servicedesk/projects/undefined/queues]

h3. Expected Results

Jira asks the user to log in to view the content.

h3. Actual Results

Jira redirects the user to [https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/<PKEY>/undefined/jira/servicedesk/projects/undefined/queues|https://instance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/PKEY/undefined/jira/servicedesk/projects/undefined/queues] with a 404 page.
Video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/z8uXjn6x

h3. Workaround

- Log in to the instance before accessing the queues URL
- Access the instance without the queues, e.g. [https://instance.atlassian.net/projects/<PKEY>|https://instance.atlassian.net/projects/PKEY]
fields.summary: Accessing the queues URL while logged off will throw a 404 instead of log in page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Dynamic user picker fields created using add-on [Extension for Jira service desk|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212161/extension-for-jira-service-desk?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] by vendor *Deviniti* fails to fetch the user list on the customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dynamic Approver field on a request type from the *Project settings* > *Dynamic forms* (available with the add-on)
# Invite a user on the instance with no application access and add the user as a customer in this service desk project
# Set the share permission 
# Login as the customer on the portal to raise a request and try to search for the users in the dynamic user picker field

h3. Expected Results
With the correct Customer permission set, the customer should be able to browse other users and customers from the portal 

h3. Actual Results
- The customer is not able to browse other users and customers from the portal. *403 forbidden* error is reported in the developer tools
{noformat}
Request URL:https://<instance>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/groupuserpicker?query=swati&projectId=10012&fieldId=customfield_10003&showAvatar=true&excludeConnectAddons=true&maxResults=10&_r=1585653232753
Request Method:GET
Status Code: 403 Forbidden
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Vendor *Deviniti* is aware of it and they are working on a way to fix it

h3.Workaround
- Currently, the workaround is not to use a dynamic user picker field. Instead, use a custom filed from Jira for user picker fields
fields.summary: Dynamic user picker fields created using add-on Extension for Jira service desk fail to fetch users on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL like : "Time to done" = breached() returns an error "Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again." if there are a lot of time metric with the same name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Login to the instance

2. Go to Advance Search and run a JQL against an SLA that has many goals (eg: 1000)

3. We will see an error "Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again."

4. Reload the Page

5. We will see a "500 Internal Server Error"
h3. Expected Results

JQL should give the results
h3. Actual Results

"Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again." with a Stack Overflow Exception in the logs
h3. Workaround

Only workaround we have currently is to reduce the number of SLA goals in order for the JQL to work fine. This can be done by deleting the un-used service desk projects.
fields.summary: Running a JQL on an SLA that has many Goals returns an error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Approver fields with the character '&' on its name will not trigger the  "Approval required" notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a NextGen project, create an approval with the following settings:
#* *Who chooses approvers?* - "Agent selects approvers"
#* *Approver field* - "Field A&B".
##  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!   
# Create a ticket using the request type above.
# Select an approver.
#* View on the issue after the approver is selected:  
#* !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

The approver receives the email notification.

h3. Actual Results

- The Approver will not receive the email notification
- By checking the automation rules audit logs, it's possible to see that the  "Approval required" customer notification *was not triggered*.
 
h3. Notes

The error was replicated with the character '&' on the field name. No other character has been tested.

h3.Workaround

Reconfigure the approval step using a different field.
fields.summary: The Approval required notification won't be triggered if the approval custom field has a '&' on its name
Allow removal of issue key in customer notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When visiting the portal of a *Jira Service Desk* project, the *Statuspage for Jira Service Desk* add-on does not load.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install *Statuspage for Jira Service Desk* (located [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216079/statuspage-for-jira-service-desk?hosting=cloud&tab=overview])
 # Go to a *Jira Service Desk* portal

h3. Expected Results
The add-on responds.

h3. Actual Results
The app doesn't load and shows *App is not responding. Wait or cancel?* instead.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Statuspage for Jira Service Desk app is not responding

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6034].
{panel}
h3. Problem definition
After creating a ticket on the customer portal, users are directed to the ticket view.

h3. Suggested solution
Implement the ability to choose the landing page after creating a ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to choose the landing page after ticket creation on the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding the options 'Reporter' or 'Service Desk Customers' (project role) to the *Add Comments* permission in the permissions scheme causes customer replies to service desk notifications to be added as internal comments even if the project mail handler is turned off.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 'Reporter' or 'Service Desk Customers' (project role) to the *Add Comments* permission in the permissions scheme associated with your project;
 # Disable email requests;
 # Create a request on behalf of a customer (make sure to select a valid request type so your customer will receive notifications);
 # Ask your customer to reply to the 'Request created' notification.

h3. Expected Results

The reply won't be added as a comment since the project mail handler is disabled.
h3. Actual Results

The reply is processed by the *Default Cloud Mail Server* (Jira settings > System > Incoming mail) and is added to the issue as an internal comment.
h3. Workaround

Add *Service desk customer - portal access* to the permission scheme and make sure that the permission is not granted to 'Reporter' or 'Service Desk Customers.
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Permission scheme allows unlicensed users to add internal comments to issues

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to notify customers when a KB article is updated.

*Suggested solution*
Provide the ability for customers to watch articles and receive notifications about updates.
fields.summary: Customer notifications for changes in KB articles

fields.description:
h3. Problem

As an agent, I want to be able to search for issues to link by key words in their description from the new issue view issue linking experience.

h3. Example use case

If I get a lot of duplicate issues/emails from the same customer, I can search for keywords in the description (which is the email body) to close these quickly.

h3. Workaround

Use JQL search text ~ parameter to find the issues to link from the Jira Issue Navigator and then link by the issue key from the ticket.
fields.summary: Allow searching for an issue to link by the description/Summary field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have a Free Jira Software Plan and a licensed Jira Service desk plan on the same site, no projects including the licensed Service Desk projects will display in the option to "Create with shared configuration" even though the functionality should only be disabled for the Jira Software project types tied to the Free plan per disabled functionality in the [Limitations in Jira Cloud Free plans|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/limitations-in-jira-cloud-free-plans-979432180.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In an instance with Jira Software set to a free plan and Jira Service Desk set to A paid license
# Create a Project
# Select the "Create with shared configuration" check box
# Select the choose a project dialogue drop down

h3. Expected Results
All projects for the licensed product are shown and projects in the Free plan are not shown do to the imposed [Limitations in Jira Cloud Free plans|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/limitations-in-jira-cloud-free-plans-979432180.html] not allowing the feature on a free plans

h3. Actual Results
No projects are listed including Service Desk projects that are connected the the licensed application
!Screen Shot 2020-03-26 at 2.03.06 PM.png|thumbnail! !Screen Shot 2020-03-26 at 2.34.09 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Having a free plan and a licensed plan together disables Create with shared configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, it's not possible to delete any default/custom status from Next-Gen Service Desk Projects, only remove it from a Workflow, which may result in many available and unused statuses.
h3. Suggestion

Add a new button called "Remove from Workflow" and Update the "Delete Status" button in Status Details.
 For the "{color:#FF0000}*Delete Status*{color}" button:
 * Jira will show a pop-up asking if the user really wants to delete the Status
 * It only allows deleting if any other workflow isn't using the Status.
 * If the user confirms, it will delete the Status from the entire project.

For the "*Remove from Workflow*" button:
 * Jira will only remove the Status from the current Workflow.

*Actual*:  
!Actual.png|thumbnail! 
*Suggestion*:  
!Expected.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to delete status in JSD Next-Gen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes an SLA timer will appear to be stopped when it should in fact be shown to be running, however, upon the event that would trigger the SLA time to stop the SLA is calculated correctly and the resulting time displayed includes the time that the clock should have been running but appeared to be stopped. 

It seems ROLEX may be missing certain SLA events.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Unable to reproduce as the issue is intermittent

h3. Expected Results
SLA timer should show as running when expected.

h3. Actual Results
SLA timer displays as stopped when in fact it should be running.
This is confirmed by JQL searches as the JQL also shows the SLA to be stopped. 


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: SLA timers not always displayed as running but calculated correctly when stopped

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes Jira service desk process an auto-reply email successfully instead of Rejecting it, even when there is no allow list is in place. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Cannot reproduce on all the instances. Send an automated email with Auto-Submitted header to as service desk support email address.

h3. Expected Results
The email should be rejected due to the Auto-Submitted header in place for the email.

h3. Actual Results
Jira service desk Mail handlers strip the Auto-Submitted header and email gets processed successfully.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sometimes Jira service desk process an auto-reply email successfully instead of Rejecting it, even when there is no allow list is in place

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the instance has a big number of customer accounts, when opening the Customers page in the project, not all customers are listed on the page. The list is limited to 250 customers. However, when the agent searches the customer, it's searchable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the project
 # Go to Customers page

h3. Expected Results
All customers are listed on the page.

h3. Actual Results
Not all customers are listed since it will only list 250 customers, but if try to search, can be found.

h3. Workaround
Check the list of customers from the "People" page
fields.summary: Unable to load all customers in the Customers page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Causes:

# Issues that are moved between projects are losing the SLA information when the SLA cycle is finished.
# Updates to SLA goals also causes the issue SLA data to disappear when the cycle is closed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Cause 1:

# Create an SLA that starts on *Issue created* and stops at a status of the workflow
# Create a ticket in another project
# Move this ticket to the project were you created the SLA
# Transition the ticket to stop the SLA cycle

Cause 2: 

# Create a ticket with an SLA
# Update the SLA goal
# Close the SLA cycle 

h3. Expected Results

The SLA will continue to display and with a finished cycle.

h3. Actual Results

The SLA disappear from the UI, in both new and old issue view.

h3. Workaround

Contact support.
fields.summary: SLA disappears when the SLA cycle is completed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When choosing the *Share settings with an existing project Choose project* option during project creation, *Jira Service Desk* projects are not shown, but used to be.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to create a classic *Jira Service Desk* project
 # Choose the *Share settings with an existing project Choose project* option

h3. Expected Results
Existing *Jira Service Desk* projects are shown

h3. Actual Results
No existing *Jira Service Desk* projects are shown

h3. Workaround

Please contact support to apply a workaround to fix this problem.
fields.summary: Existing Service desk projects not shown when selecting Share settings with an existing project Choose project during project creation

fields.description:
h1. Summary
Currently, when an agent raises a request on behalf of a customer, it doesn't show the agent's name and incorrectly shows the customer as the *Creator*.

h1. Suggested Resolution
It would be nice if the actual creator was shown as the *Creator* somewhere in the portal view of the issue and show the customer as the *Reporter* instead of the *Creator*.
May be related to ["Creator" field should be Orderable|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43387].

h1. Workaround
 There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Show Creator on portal instead of just Reporter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

If the portal is set to allow customer signup but must log in to create the request, customers who signup will receive an email as "Complete signup" email.

However, If the portal is set to allow customer signup but they can create requests without first logging in (portal is publically accessible), then new customers will not receive any email to complete the signup. They will have to select the "view request" option in the "Request created" email to be directed to the portal to complete their signup to view the request.

h3. Proposed Solution

Send a "complete signup" email to notify to new customers who create a request in a login free portal that an account has been created and to complete the signup.
fields.summary: "Complete signup" email is not sent out to customers when portal is set to login free

fields.description:
h3. Problem

We have hundreds of external users that will email us for support but know nothing about another project. We cannot allow them to see the other SD project.

h3. Why is it important?

Having external users being able to still email and create their own accounts to Service Desk projects, but hide other projects that they cannot see.

h3. Suggested resolution

Create the ability to restrict a Service Desk project in the portal, but still, let customers email to it.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict a project but still have customers creating their own accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The Service Desk projects have been removed from the "Share settings with an existing project" drop-down while creating a new project. 

h3. Why is it important?

Instances with only Service Desk cannot have projects sharing the same schemes, because it is not possible to create the projects with shared options.

h3. Suggested resolution

Bring back the Service Desk projects into the shared configurations drop-down.
fields.summary: Bring back the Service Desk projects in the shared configurations drop-down

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an agent is creating a request on behalf of a customer using the customer portal, the agent is unable to share the request with the organization of the customer using the "Share with" field.

h3. Suggested Solution
It should be possible for an agent to share the request with the organization of the account entered as the reporter when creating a request on behalf of a customer in the customer portal.

h3. Workaround
After the request is created, add the customer's organization in the agent view.
fields.summary: Agents creating requests on behalf of customers can't share request with an organization from the customer portal

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Service Desk projects don't support the Development panel in its issue view. 
Only Software projects, classic and next-gen, and also classic JSD projects support this functionality.
fields.summary: Allow next-gen projects to support the Development panel

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, it's possible to add People field on next-gen projects, but it's not possible to restrict who will appear on this list. 
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the option "Configure" to the field, so we can use the "Edit user filtering" and add a group of people to show in the dropdown. This is the option we see on "User Picker (single user)" for system custom fields.

For JSD this option is great if we want to restrict customers to select their managers, for example, so they won't see other customers and users.
fields.summary: Ability to configure "People" field in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently we have the ability to access/comment requests with other users within the same organization. This is set under Project settings > Customer permissions:
{quote}Who can customers share requests with?
Other customers in their organization. This option only allows them to search for customers in their organization.{quote}

The suggestion is to have the ability to share requests/issues with other users in their organization with '*Read Only*' access

h3. Desired Results
# on Jira Service Desk
# Have a customer create a request
# When set - some customers in the organization will have the ability to access/edit/comment, whilst others will only be able to '*Read only*'
# Customer's in same organization with Read only permission will only be able to view the requests, not comment
fields.summary: Allow customers to share with read only permission to Other customers in their organization

fields.description:
I want to be able to automatically link a confluence page on issue creation, however the "Edit Field" - "Linked Issue" action only allows to link a Jira issue in the automation rules as of now. 

I would love if you added a way to link a Confluence page here like you do in the normal issue edit screens.
fields.summary: JSD Automation rules doesn't allow for Confluence page links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The german translation for the word "changed" is wrong in the Jira Service Desk customer notifications. The status changed notification uses the wrong german word for "changed" in the email template. The German word for "changed" is "geändert" whereas the email template uses the word "genabnet"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable notifications for status changed and use german language pack.
 # Change the status of a ticket to get an email notification. 

h3. Expected Results

The word "geändert" is used for "changed".
h3. Actual Results

The word "genabnet" is used.
h3. Workaround

The email template can be updated by the user from the Project Settings->Customer notifications.
fields.summary: Incorrect German Translation

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to have approver responses be a trigger for *Automation*. Currently, it is only possible to trigger based on if an approval is required or the approval process has been completed, but not possible to trigger when an approval responds.

An example use case is when a workflow requires more than 1 approval and their individual responses are needed in order to perform additional actions on the ticket as the individual approvers submit their response and tiered approvals are not wanted.
fields.summary: Ability to sense an approver's response in realtime

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With the new SLA system when an agent leave a public comment the comment is considered as *Comment: For Customer* and the SLA stopped because the condition met. However, when someone delete the comment that iniate the stop condition, the SLA recalculated and causing the SLA takes the next comment from an agent as the stopped condition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an SLA with the STOP condition as *Comment: For Customers* 
# Create an issue that will trigger this SLA
# Add a public comment as an agent. The SLA should stopped.
# Then, add another comment as an agent
# Then , remove the first comment
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
The SLA time remain.

h3. Actual Results
The SLA time change and take the 2nd comment to stop the SLA.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: "Comment: For Customers" SLA condition is being restarted when the first comment deleted

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users that exist only in the customer role should still be able to create requests via the REST API.  Trying to reproduce this today by following the documentation in [POST /rest/servicedeskapi/request|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-post] I find this is not possible to do.  It appears that this endpoint is only working for users in the Agent role.  But the existing docs do not make it clear that being an agent is required here. (I understand it is required to be an Agent to use the RaiseOnBehalfOf parameter, but I'm not trying to use that one in this case).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic Jira Service Desk project
# Invite a customer to join that service desk (that is not currently in your Jira site)
# Have the customer login to the customer portal successfully at least once to make sure it works and they can see the request types there
# As a customer, create a REST API token for yourself as per [Basic auth for REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/basic-auth-for-rest-apis/]
# Try as a customer to create a request in that portal via the REST API using basic auth, this example uses curl {code:borderStyle=solid}
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://[redacted].atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/request' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic [redacted]' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "serviceDeskId": "2",
  "requestTypeId": "17",
  "requestFieldValues": {
    "summary": "Request JSD help via REST",
    "description": "Example description"
  }
}' 
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Request is created successfully with the customer that is making this request as the reporter.


h3. Actual Results
curl command returns result of 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
{"errorMessage":"You don't have permission to access this Service Desk.","i18nErrorMessage":{"i18nKey":"sd.agent.servicedesk.error.project.nopermission","parameters":[]} 
{code}
 
h3. Notes
From reading the documentation on this, it is not clear that a customer would be unable to perform this action.  

h3.Workaround
This works if the user is an Agent, but that work-around is not viable in all use cases.
fields.summary: Users in customer role only are unable to create requests via the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Service Desk, users that only have the customer role are not able to create requests or see their own requests via the REST API.  Instead connect add-on apps are instead encouraged to use an account that is an agent in order to create requests on behalf of customers.   This could be greatly simplified to just let customers make authenticated requests to a REST API in order to create/manage their own requests.


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow authentication customers to use a REST API endpoint to create and update their requests

h3. Why this is important
Email and customer portal use should not be the only means for a customer to create a request.  This is important because users should not need to be an Agent just to create a request via REST.
fields.summary: Users that only have the customer role in Service Desk should be able to use the REST API to create and update their requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the collapsed sidebar you can display the menu by hovering in the sidebar area. However, when you click on Channels a pop-up opens. When you leave the sidebar area to go click on the pop-up the sidebar collapses again and the pop-up closes before you can click on it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter a Service Desk project;
 # Collapse the sidebar;
 # Hover the sidebar to open it;
 # Click on Channels;
 # Try to click on the options in the pop-up.

h3. Expected Results

The sidebar doesn't collapse when you move the cursor to the Channels pop-up.
h3. Actual Results

The sidebar collapses again and the pop-up closes before you can click on it.
Video: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quBNn8o] 
h3. Workaround

Use the expanded sidebar.
fields.summary: Channels pop-up close before you can click if you open it from the collapsed sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The current Jira share option is not very clear with regards to handling share use cases with customers. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Jira service desk issue, use the share option in the agent view
 # Share the issue with a customer. 

h3. Expected Results

The share option should be clear that it should be used for sharing with other users that has product access.  Request participant should be used for sharing the ticket with customers. 


h3. Actual Results

1. It is not clear that the share option should not be used for customer use cases. 
2. There is a misleading message  : *People without access will be sent an invitation to join*

 !share agent.png|thumbnail! 

* This currently will not send any invitations. 


h3. Workaround
Use *Request Participant* to share service desk tickets with customers.
fields.summary: Jira share is misleading for customer share use cases

fields.description:
h3. Summary Creating a ticket, without request type, on an approval workflow will still send the Approval required customer notification, if the customer notification is left with the default text. If the ${request.status} variable is added to the Approval required customer notification no notification is generated. h3. Environment Jira Service Desk customer notifications. h3.Steps to reproduce * 1. Access the Approval required customer notification and leave it with the default text; {code}This request created by ${issue.reporter.name} is awaiting approval.{code} * 2. Add an approval step on your workflow; * 3. Create a ticket from Jira, without a request type; * 4. The customer notification will be sent. h3. Expected results No customer notification is sent since the ticket does not have a valid request type set. h3. Actual result The Approval required customer notification is sent. !Screen Shot 2020-03-17 at 15.14.53.png|thumbnail! h3. Side Effect If the ${request.status} variable is added to the customer notification template, the notification will be sent, but no status will be shown and the variable will show instead. !Screen Shot 2020-03-17 at 15.11.49.png|thumbnail! {code:html}
Reply above this line.
${message.content} AVAILABLE VARIABLES: ${request.status}
{code} h3. Workaround None at the moment.
fields.summary: Tickets created using an Approval workflow sends the Approval required customer notification, even if the ticket does not have a valid request type

fields.description: Can someone please help to get the cards on the board moved around so you can place then anywhere on the board and not just one after the other as you create a new one? So in other words to have the ability to move cards on the board to position underneath each other or above another however you want to place them vertically and not just horizontally.
fields.summary: Trello Boards card movement

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Agents replying to numerous customer requests each day want to streamline this process as much as possible. Clicking around the request view is time consuming.

h3. Proposed solution

Currently, Jira has the short cut *M* to add a comment to an issue. However, this defaults to the "Internal note" comment type. 

Add a separate short cut to add a "Reply to customer" comment type.
fields.summary: Create a short cut / hot link to reply to customer

fields.description:
h3. Problem

While creating a new project role on a next-gen project, the permission "Work on requests" does not say that the user must have the application access of Jira Service Desk to have that working.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add the product access warning to this permission too.
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-13 at 12.55.05.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The "Work on requests" permission under Next-Gen manage roles should contain the product access warning

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not able to scroll articles at the customer portal on IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on a space that is linked with a JSD project.
 # Create an article with a few paragraphs.
 # Access the article within the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
* Be able to read the entire article.

h3. Actual Results
The article is not scrollable and we can't read it.
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* User other browsers such as Chrome, Firefox...
fields.summary: Not able to scroll articles at the customer portal on IE 11
Comments or issue descriptions created by HTML emails or which have lots of formatting in the old issue view containing over 590 rows are not rendered in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a project has hidden request types, these hidden request types, these request types will appear on the request type drop-down options on the "My request" page on the portal.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the project settings > Request types > Hide a request type
 # Go to the portal > "My requests" 
 # Select the Request Type drop down field:  !image-2020-03-13-20-31-36-480.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The hidden request type will not be found as an option to select.

h3. Actual Results

The request type is still available for selection.

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Hidden request types still appear on the "My Request" request type drop down for selection

fields.description:
Is there any way to change the text on this button in the portal?

 

!image-2020-03-12-14-58-47-385.png!
fields.summary: Customise raise a request button in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, SLA will only restart if it meets the "Start" condition. However, there's a scenario whereby agent need to update the customer every 1 hour (for example). Status can't be changed and resolution and assignee field will not changed too. There are no options to set the "Start" condition to restart again the time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options to restart the SLA every time it stop regardless of the start condition. This will allow the SLA to have multiple loops. It will only remain to stop once it meets certain criteria. 

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: SLA have options to restart the time automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Development teams have captured a scenario where emails sent from inboxes with capitalisation are not being processed. The problem only impacted a small percentage of customers as the change that triggered the problem was rolled out to 10% of instances. This has now been mitigated and older emails are being reprocessed, so you may see email related updates from the time range below being processed on 12th March 2020. 

Start: 09-03-2020 23:35 UTC
Mitigated: 11-03-2020 15:30 UTC 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # A JSD instance enables emails to be sent to create tickets or update comments. It is configured that only existing users can sent emails (as opposed to everyone).
 # A user with an email address that has any capitalisation in them sends email to this JSD instance via emailing the service desk email address.

h3. Expected Results

Any new request created at the time range above becomes an issue in your service desk and is added to the queue immediately.For existing issues, customer replies to the issue and  the reply displays as a comment on the issue in the service desk. 
h3. Actual Results
 * These new requests and responses are processed only on the 12th March
 * These updates will appear in the relevant JSD Queue and tickets but at a delayed time.

h3. Example Scenario
 * On 9th March at 11.45 pm UTC, Customer A whose email is [Abc@a.b|mailto:Abc@a.b]  and customer B whose email address is [bcd@a.b|mailto:bcd@a.b] send an email each to servicedesk email address at instance A, expecting their requests to create a new issue for them at the relevant service desk project.
 * Customer B's issue is created immediately.
 * Customer A's issue is created later on March 12th.

h3. Workaround

Not needed since Developers have already run the required reprocessing of these emails.
fields.summary: Incoming email from an address containing capital letters has been delayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The customer is experiencing significant delays in batch notifications delivery, it affects all JSD issues of the instance.

There are 3 causes identified:
 # High frequency of notification triggered, this could occur if there are multiple automation rule setup, or there are simply too many events that need notification (lots of issue comment/update)
 # High amount of customers in an organization. For each one of them, a notification email has to be sent through, contributing to the high amount of notification mentioned in point 1.
 # Bottleneck in processing pipeline of the notifications: each notification is queued waiting to be processed, and the processing job could not catch up with the rate of new notifications that came through. Currently, notification processing is done sequentially per issue-and-recipient combination.

h3. Log Messages

We see a lot of messages like:
{code:java}
Service Desk notification delayed by xxxxxxx ms
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Batch notifications should not be delayed

h3. Actual Results
Batch notifications in JSD are delayed for a variable number of hours.

h3. Workaround
 # Temporarily turning off notifications will allow currently queued ones to be processed, but the problem can recur when it's turned back on.
 # Reducing the number of customers that need to be notified in an organization / turning this off altogether.
fields.summary: batch notification delays for customer notifications

fields.description:
Currently, in *Jira Service Desk* (and other Jira products), there is a *Share* button to share an issue with other licensed users or invite them.

While this is fine for *Jira Software* *Jira Core* projects, it can cause confusion for *Jira Service Desk* projects as users may think this is the appropriate way to share an issue with a customer.

It would be nice if there was something in the modal for *Jira Service Desk* projects thayt clarified that this isn't for customers and let users know to add customers as *Request participants*.
fields.summary: Share button in Jira issue view can cause confusion for users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a customer creates an SLA which is set to start on ISSUE CREATION but then pauses on the initial status of the issue the event which is triggered is a START & PAUSE only the start is actioned and the SLA timer keeps running.

Furthermore to try and work around this transitioning the issue status back to the same status fails to pause the issue also.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an SLA with start condition of ISSUE CREATION
 # Have the first status in the workflow be *Waiting* or similar.
 # Set the SLA to pause on entering the status *Waiting* or whatever the initial issue status of the workflow is.

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be created and the SLA immediately be paused.
h3. Actual Results
The SLA continues to run.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: SLA Rules set to start on ISSUE CREATION and pause on the initial issue status do not pause.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sending emails to Jira Service Desk Mail Handler with over 32767 characters will result in the creation of an Issue with incomplete description.

*Additional Notes* : It's good to note that this don't only affect the description field but also the comments as well in new JIRA issue view. Also this problem can also be replicated by JIRA REST API. If the comment/description are added by a JIRA REST end point, it will be added without issue but will not display in new JIRA issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Service Desk mail handler
# Send an email with over 32767 characters on it.

h3. Expected Results
Jira does not process the email and forwards a proper error message. Example: "Message exceeds the character limit".

h3. Actual Results
Jira creates a new issue with the description of only 32767 characters, also leave a blank description in the New Issue View.

h3. Notes
The description will fill until it reaches 32767 characters after this will replace the last 3 characters with three dots. Also, Jira won't convert the text from Wiki to ADF, so the description only can be seen in the Old Issue View. 

h3. Workaround
None available.
fields.summary: Email with over 32k characters results in Issue with empty description in New Issue View

fields.description:
Having one (or many) Service Desks processing mails can cause the database to clog really fast. 

There is currently the option to execute the database cleaner every certain time, with the minimum being 14 days. It would be good to have the option for it to be executed more often than that or to execute it manually.
fields.summary: Allow executing the Database cleaner more often or on demand (Global Mail Settings)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the portal, *Requests* > *All* doesn't show the requests waiting for the customer's approvals.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create any ticket having you as one of the approvers
 # At the portal, select *Requests* > *Approvals* and see there is the issue waiting for your approval
 # At the portal, select *Requests* > *All* and see there is no issue waiting for your approval

 !Screenshot 2020-03-10 15.35.12.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

In the portal, *All* shows every request the customer having browsing permission.

h3. Actual Results

*Requests* > *All* doesn't show the requests waiting for the customer's approvals.

h3. Workaround

Use *Requests* > *Approvals* instead.
fields.summary: Include approvals to Requests > All in Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When changing a request type, default values for fields are respected, but when changed to a request type without default values for that field, the previous request type's value stays.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup 2 or more request types that use a field
 # Set a default value for a field on one of the request types
 # Don't set a default for that same field on another request type
 # Create an issue from within Jira (i.e., not in the portal)
 # Switch between the 2 request types and observe that the field retains the default value for the request type that specifies a default value (even when switching to the request type that doesn't have a default set)

h3. Expected Results
The field is blanked when no default is set for a given request type

h3. Actual Results
The field retains the value from the previous request type

h3. Workaround

In the meantime, if it fits your use case, it is suggested to not set a default and instead set the field as required if it fits your use case to do so.
fields.summary: Changing a request type in create screen doesn't update field values in some cases

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there are limited options for Edit Issue action.

Impossible with Automation Rules to set Organization Field with a specific value.

This feature will be great and make good improvement for Jira Service Desk admins or teams.
h3. Suggest Resolution

Add organization field in Edit Issue fields list.

 

!image-2020-03-09-13-33-50-255.png!
fields.summary: Add Organization field to Edit Issue Automation Component

fields.description:
Problem Definition:

There are endpoints to add user, remove user and all in Jira service desk but there is no endpoint to delete a customer account. It's a time-consuming task to manually delete 1000 users from the user management

Suggested Solution:

It will be great if there is an API endpoint to delete the customer account.
fields.summary: REST API endpoint to delete customer account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When "Label" field have a default value , it doesn't display in the Customer Portal. However, once the issue created, the value populated to the issue.

In Next gen Project , the "Label" default value set at the field layout configuration.
In Classic project , the "Label" default value set at the custom field context configuration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* For Next Gen project
 # Open Next gen project
# Go to Request Types configuration
 # Add "Label" field to the request form 
# Set default value for the field
# Open the request form in Customer Portal

* For Classic project
# Open the custom field context configuration and set a default value
# Add the field in the request form
# Open the request form in Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results
The default value display in the request form.

h3. Actual Results
The default value doesn't display :-
!Screenshot 2020-03-09 at 2.02.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
No workaround. However, if it's not needed the customer to view the field, remove the field from the request form and place it under *Context Field*. The value will still populated eventhough the issue created from portal.
fields.summary: Default values in label fields are rendered truncated in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When tickets are accessed under the queues, the sort activities / comments / Work log / History button don't reorder the activities.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access the queues;
 # Select an issue;
 # Click on the issue key;
 # Try to reorder activities.

h3. Expected Results
The sort activity button doesn't reorder the activities.

h3. Workaround
Accessing tickets out of the queues the sort button is working normally.
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-06 at 16.27.39.png!

h3. Actual Results
The JSD user is accessing the tickets out of the queues.
fields.summary: Sort activities or comment button don't reorder activities under the queues

fields.description:
h2. Problems
h3. Configurability

Recently, it was added the possibility to create an issue using the Request type instead of the Issue type. This option is great because now it's not necessary to create automation or manually add the Request type after the ticket is created for customers to receive notifications, but not everyone wants to use this option.

Some companies may use many Request types with the same name and it may be confusing for the Agent that is creating the ticket or the list is very long and it's necessary to scroll down to find the Issue types.
h3. Issue creation experience

When changing a request type, default values for fields are respected, but when changed to a request type without default values for that field, the previous request type's value stays.

If the Request/Issue type name is too long, it's not possible to view its entire name on the drop-down list.
h2. Suggestions
h3. Configurability

To give the administrator the right to deactivate this feature.

To give the administrator the possibility to display the issue types before the request types on this field.

To add the request type group name next to the request type in this field, without it impacting the request type name on the portal.
h3. Issue creation experience

Blank out fields without a default for a given request type, when that type is selected. At least if the fields we populated automatically by the defaults of the previously selected request type.

Automatically change the size of the field based on the longest Request/Issue type name.
fields.summary: Improvements for Request types (Create issue screen)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the reports in the Jira Service Desk can only be generated for one year. This could be a concern for users who want to compare or look back on the data from the previous years.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide users the ability to select the timeframe for the report going back to previous years.
h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Provide ability to the user to view the Jira Service Desk reports more than a year old

fields.description: Currently, it is possible to copy values from certain fields (e.g., *Summary* and *Description*), but it would be nice if other fields (including custom fields) could be duplicated when using *Automation* to create issues.
fields.summary: Ability to copy values from other fields when using Automation to create an issue

fields.description:
Currently, the customer satisfaction survey is sent automatically once the issue is resolved. As an admin, it would be handy to be able to set the number of days after which the survey is sent.

One business case would be to provide the customer with a time buffer to reopen a case before getting the satisfaction survey and provide meaningful feedback.
fields.summary: Ability to set when the customer satisfaction survey should be sent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you don't have the Global permission to create Next-gen projects, a "Connection lost" generic error is displayed when trying to create a Next-gen project in Jira Service desk.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to Jira Settings > System > Global permission
# Delete public group in the *Create Next-gen Projects* permission
# Try to create a Service desk next-gen project 

h3. Expected Results
The project is not created, informing you don't have the permission to do it.

h3. Actual Results
The project is not created and the following generic error is displayed:
 !screen_shot_2020-03-04_at_18.12.01.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add yourself to the global permission to be able to create the project and avoid the error.
fields.summary: Connection lost error when trying to create SD Next-gen Projects without global permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, after adding a new customer to a project, it takes around 15 seconds to sync with the userbase, so refreshing the page makes it seems the customer wasn't added. After waiting for a few seconds, if we refresh the page, the customer is there.

h3. Suggestion
Improve the syncing time when adding single customers - when adding them to an organization, the delay basically doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Improve the syncing time between JIRA and the userbase when adding customers

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, the "Related Knowledge Base Articles" generates article suggestions that might be related to the ticket, it is not always accurate and doesn't tell why is the article even suggested. The user needs to manually check what matches and what doesn't. This leads to some articles which are empty being suggested too.

*Suggested Solution*

Improving the algorithm on how the articles match would be highly appreciated. Though this might be a tough undertaking. 

In the interim, if there is a system that shows "matches" and highlights as to why it was shown as a "Related knowledge base article", that would be really helpful to know and understand the suggestion. 

For example, issue summary: "This is a test issue"
Article Suggested: How to Troubleshoot and perform Tests
Match highlights: "This article was chosen because the word "test" was matched. 

This provides some clarity and doesn't mislead the agent into thinking the article has some linking when it doesn't.
fields.summary: Improve how  the "Related Knowledge Base Articles" works

fields.description:
Problem definition: 

As per the design, we do not notify customers about other requests raised within a project due to security reasons. If customers wish to share the request with other users or notify them about their request then they can choose to share their request with the customer or one of the organization

Suggested solution:

Provide the option to notify customers without a license about all newly created issues in a service desk project

Workaround:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/add-request-participants-automatically-when-creating-an-issue-in-jira-server-777026955.html
fields.summary: Ability to notify customers without a license about newly created issues in a servicedesk project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding multiple attachments to Widget, it removed the old attachment and only keep one attachment which is the latest one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the widget
 # Attached first file:-
 !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 12.56.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Then, attached another file :-
 !Screenshot 2020-03-03 at 12.56.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Widget accept multiple attachment.

h3. Actual Results
It removed the first attachment and keep the latest file attached.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: When adding multiple attachment to Widget , it removed the old attachment and only keep one attachment

fields.description: i want to extend my jira service
fields.summary: i want to extend my jira service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding attachments more than >70 (varies based on the number)
All the attachments will show as a blank attachment.
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-02 at 3.06.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add more than 70 attachments in a comment and save

h3. Expected Results
Attachments loads fine

h3. Actual Results
Shows as blank attachment

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Status 431 - The HTTP 431 Request Header Fields Too Large response status code indicates that the server is unwilling to process the request because its header fields are too large
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

The old issue view loads the attachment
fields.summary: In new issue view, attachments shows failed to load when attachment is more than 70 (it varies based on the size)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting a default value for a custom field or a field like *Priority*, the default value is not selected in the portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with a default or set a default *Priority*
 # Add the field to a *Request type*
 # Go to the portal for that *Request type*
 # Observe that the field does not show the default value (which is default on the *Create* screen in Jira)

h3. Expected Results
The default value shown.

h3. Actual Results
The default value is not shown.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Default values for fields do not show on the portal

fields.description:
I have a new project to work on . I need your suggestion to achieve my requirement. 

I want to type a question in the custom field and it should suggest the relevant questions for that. 

For example: 

I will give set of questions on different topics like sports, activities , news, three questions on each topic. 

And in the custom field i will type the question as :  i want to know today's news. 

will the tool pick all three related questions which has the key word "NEWS"
fields.summary: Custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to rebuild an SLA for issue via the REST endpoint for recalculation of corrupt SLA's this no longer works.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project
 # Create an SLA and goal
 # Create an issue that triggers the SLA
 # Resolve and close the test issue
 # Update the SLA goal
 # Run the REST call to recalculate the SLA for the closed issue
{code:bash}
curl --location --request POST 'https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sla/admin/task/destructive/reconstruct?force=true' \
--header 'Accept: application/json' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'Authorization: Basic <AUTH_TOKEN_BASE64>' \
--data-raw '["ISSUE-KEY"]'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The SLA should be updated for the requested issue.

h3. Actual Results
No recalculation is actioned

h3. Workaround
Please contact Atlassian Support for assistance as we can run recalculations for you in the interim.
fields.summary: SLA recalculation endpoint no longer working

fields.description: Currently, the article is being searched based on the keywords whats the customer enter. There should also be functionality the article should be searched using the tags as well
fields.summary: Search KB article based on tags

fields.description:
The JSD Customer Portal "Request Create" page allows fields on the page to be pre-populated when the page is loaded via {{field_id=field_value}} URL parameters. Working out the correct field id to use, and the allowed values, is not very intuitive. In fact right now the only way to do this is to analyze REST calls made by the page on load, and extrapolate the field ids from there.

If there was a button on the Request Create page that generated a URL based on the fields present on the page, and the values currently entered in them, this would make the URL param pre-population feature much more usable.

Here's an example of how this could look:
 !jsd_req_create_pre_pop_button.png|thumbnail! 

When the user clicks the "Generate URL" button, a link is copied to their clipboard. This link opens the same Request Create page, with the values entered already pre-populated.
fields.summary: Allow portal request create pre-populated links to be generated via a button

fields.description:
Currently, whenever the agent moves or updates issue type, if there is an existing status in the other issue type, the issue moved will have its status transited to the same status.

 

 Can it be possible if whenever the issue type is moved, can the status be re-assigned?

 

Here is one of the scenarios of its application:

 

 My organisation has two types of workflow:
 * Standard Service Request (Uses one level of approval prior to agent working on issue) !image-2020-02-27-16-29-07-901.png!

 
 * Non-Standard Service Request or Access Request (Uses two levels of approval prior to agent working on issue) !image-2020-02-27-16-29-56-695.png!

 

 

The agent set the issue type from the Triage Pool to "Standard Service Request".

After receiving approval from the Business Sponsor, the agent realizes that it is an "Access Request"

 Thus he/she updates the issue type, and unfortunately the status stays in 'In-Progress' status, and the agent missed out the second level of approval.

 Although an update in the workflow templates can be used as a workaround, what if our organisation has lots of scenarios that makes re-defining the workflow templates a chore?

 Thus it would have been convenient if this feature is available and not automatically set the status if the other workflow template in the issue type has the same status but in a different position in the workflow.
fields.summary: Allow reassignment of status when moving issues

fields.description:
*_Use Case_*

It is a common use case that portal tickets requires approval from the reporter's Manager. Reporters currently have to either choose this approver manually or automation rules based on site group membership needs to be configured. 

Third party IDPs that can be integrated with Atlassian Access already provide these team-manager data but we cannot use them yet within the service desk portal. 

*Suggestion* :

- Allow third party IDP account attributes to be used within Jira service desk
ie. User's Manager and Team/Department attributes (see ACCESS-822)
- Allow approval workflows to automatically use the reporter's Manager and Team data. (see JRACLOUD-73346)
fields.summary: Allow third party team data to be used with service desk projects.

fields.description: It would be nice if an administrator could select multiple users in the *Jira Service Desk* (portal only customers) section of the *User management* interface and bulk/mass convert those users to Atlassian accounts.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk "Migrate to Atlassian account"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the new SLA system when an agent leave a public comment the comment is considered as *Comment: For Customer*, however, if the agent becomes a customer issue-level ( such as being request participant, member of an Organization the ticket is shared with, or an approver ) the comment will become *Comment: By Customer*. This is making the SLA to be recalculated and go to ongoing state, even if the SLA cycle was finished.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an SLA with the STOP condition as *Comment: For Customers* ( I used Time to first response SLA that had a START condition of Issue Created )
# Create an issue that will trigger this SLA
# Add a public comment as an agent
# Add the agent as a customer issue-level ( such as being request participant, member of an Organization the ticket is shared with, or an approver )
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

The SLA will remain closed with the information of a single cycle related to the public comment of when the user was an agent.

h3. Actual Results

The SLA goes to an ongoing state and another cycle is initiated. If another agent then leaves a public comment then there'll be 2 cycles for the SLA, even if the START event was Issue Created. It's possible to have multiple cycles for this SLA simply by adding the agents who made the public comment as request participants and then removing them. 
 
h3. Workaround

Add all agents who are related to the STOP event of the cycles from this SLA as request participants ( to leave the SLA in an ongoing state ), then remove the agent who made the first public comment. With this, the SLA cycle that will display is the first one created. After that, you can remove the other agents from the request participant section.

It seems that if the SLA has around 9+ cycles it isn't possible to apply the workaround.

h3. Note:

As this issue occurs when agents are added as customers to the tickets, to avoid this occurrence, consider adding the agents as [watchers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/watch-share-and-comment-on-issues-962349057.html], once request participants is a feature to share requests with customers in a JSD project.
fields.summary: Comment: For Customers SLA condition is being restarted when agent becomes a customer issue-level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting 'Allow unassigned issues' to 'OFF' you instruct the system to not allow to create issues when there is no assignee associated with the issue.
 When creating next-gen service desk projects you can set an automation rule to set a default assignee

When 'Allow unassigned issues' to 'ON' it assigns the selected default assignee

However, when this setting is set to 'OFF', the system does not recognise the default assignee and does not allow the customer to raise an issue via the portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn OFF "Allow Unassigned Issues" under global settings
 # Go to your next-gen Service Desk project
 # Check that you have a default assignee on the project
 # Raise a request via the customer portal

h3. Expected Results

Issue should be created with the default assignee picking project lead as a default assignee.
h3. Actual Results

you will get an error message: 
 *Couldn't send request*
 This form contains a hidden field that does not have a valid default value configured
h3. Workaround

Setting 'Allow unassigned issues' to 'ON'
fields.summary: Support 'Allow unassigned issues' to 'OFF' for next-gen service desk projects

fields.description: h1. Can a non JIRA admin automatically email the contents of a JIRA Dashboard daily to a predetermined set of recipients? Could that be setup from Jira or Confluence?
fields.summary: Can a non JIRA admin automatically email the contents of a JIRA Dashboard daily to a predetermined set of recipients?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a project sends a complete registration email notification while using Spanish, the notification email has incorrect characters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set instance language to Spanish
 # Create a Jira Service Desk project
 # Sign up for a customer account
 # Observe incorrect characters

h3. Expected Results
Correct characters used for notification

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Â¡Casi hemos terminado!
...
Con tecnologÃ­a de Jira Service Desk
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Registration email notification when using Spanish has incorrect characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachments are not loading when JSD customers tried to access pages directly in Confluence. However, the attachments are loading fine when the JSD customers accessed the page through the JSD portal. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSD Project
# Add a customer (with Atlassian Account) to the JSD project
# Create a Confluence space
# Create a Confluence page and add some attachments on the page
# Link the JSD Project to the Confluence space
# Allow "Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledgebase articles with your customers."
# Ask the customer to access the page directly in Confluence

h3. Expected Results
- The attachments should be loading properly when JSD customers tried to access linked Confluence pages.

h3. Actual Results
- The attachments are not loading when JSD customers tried to access linked Confluence pages. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments are not displayed when JSD customers accessed Confluence pages directly

fields.description: As a user, there should be functionality to rank the issues inside the queue and move the issue accordingly. Currently, the issues can only be ordered based on certain fields but not ranked.
fields.summary: As a user there should be functionality to rank the issues in the queue

fields.description:
Currently, when a user creates a ticket on the portal, the user is redirected to the issue in the portal. While it does mention that the issue was raised, some users may find this confusing and think there is something else to do/their issue hasn't been created.

It would be nice to have an explicit confirmation that the issue was created or even an option to take the user back to the main portal for that project or the help center.

*Update: August 11, 2021*

The ability to choose where a user is redirected after submitting a request (making this a per request type configuration would be ideal) would be helpful as not only could the user be redirected to the issue (current behavior and could be the default), but it could be configured instead to redirect back to the help center, the portal, or to a different URL altogether.
fields.summary: Ability to redirect user to a configurable location after successful issue creation on portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Service Desk portal has elembents still using http instead of https, making some browsers accuse it of being insecure


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Access the portal
# Inspect the page and search for "http://"

h3. Expected Results
No elements should be found

h3. Actual Results
Several elements are found


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Service Desk portal has elembents still using http instead of https, making some browsers accuse it of being insecure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Send" button shows the translation as "lähettää", it should be "Lähetä" in the Finnish language. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your [Personal Settings|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings] in id.atlassian.com, and set your "Language" to "Suomi".
 # Go to your instance and open a Service Desk portal and try to create a new request. 
 # You will see the following:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Finnish word should be "Lähetä"

h3. Actual Results
What it actually shows is "lähettää"


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Finnish translation for "Send" button in Service Desk portal is incorrect.

fields.description: At this time Jira Service Desk REST API allows us to approve requests on behalf of the user performing the call. It would be nice to have an option to approve on another user's behalf.
fields.summary: Add the ability to approve requests via API on another user's behalf

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On instances where "User Invites" at Site Access is set to toggled yes for "Existing users can send invitations to group" , a site admin who shares a JSD ticket to new or existing users who do no have product access inadvertently give product access to these users and they from then point on have JSD product access and instance bill may increase unexpectedly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as a site admin
 # Go to one of the JSD or Software projects (Classic or Net-gen) and open a ticket in new issue view mode.
 # Click on the share link at the top right-hand corner, and share the ticket with _new or existing customer with no product access_

h3. Expected Results

_Customer_  should be notified about it, but not get the product license (JSD). This seems to work correctly in old issue view , 
h3. Actual Results

In new issue view , _Customer A_ is being assigned the product license.
h3. Workaround

You can move back to old issue view to avoid this scenario.
fields.summary: In certain conditions site admins who share JSD tickets create users with product access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When raising an issue via the customer portal some service desk customers may not be shown the option to share the request with their organization. 

 !image-2020-02-19-11-30-33-467.png|thumbnail! 

This appears to be due to old users still using usernames in the database which don't match the external_id which is in the {{qm:xxxxx}} format. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project
 # Create an organization in this project 
 # Change customer permissions for who customers can share requests with to: _"Other customers in their organization. This option only allows them to search for customers in their organization."_
 # Add at least two customers to the organization one who has a username is the old style and doesn't match the external id and one who has a username in the {qm:xxxxxxx} format that matches the external id. 
 # Create a request on behalf of each user via the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
Both customers see the drop-down option to share the request with their organization. 
 
h3. Actual Results
Only the customer who's a username matches the external id will have the drop-down option appear the other will not. 
The below exception is thrown in the dev console of the browser:
{noformat}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Unable to get user."}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.servicedesk.error.user.not.exist","reasonCode":"400"}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Some portal customers unable to share requests with the organization they are a member of

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when administrator add *Assets* type field in the queue , the value will not be visible.

h3. Suggested Solution
Display the Assets value in the queue.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow Assets value to display in JSD queue

fields.description: When moving a ticket from JSD project A to JSD project B, if the assignee on project A doesn't have *Assignable User* and/or *Browse Project* permission in project B, the user will still be the assignee in project B, but they won't have any access to the issue or the project itself so it would be nice to clear this field value when moving tickets between projects.
fields.summary: Clear the assignee field when moving tickets between JSD projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when users access https://start.atlassian.com/ while having an active session they can see all of the sites they have access to. 

The sites/products presented on that page are only related to licenses the current user is associated with, thus, if the user only has customer access in JSD portals he won't be able to find them.

h3. Suggested Solution

Present sites where the current user has customer access.

h3. Why this is important

For companies that implement SSO https://start.atlassian.com/ can be the default landing page for their users so the current behavior can be very confusing for the users that are only customers from JSD portals.
fields.summary: Add JSD portal access into https://start.atlassian.com/
